article: I was recently invited to dinner by a friend. During the meal, the _ of the restaurant came over and said our meal was free. I was _ . He stood there smiling at me and there was an air of _ . Finally I asked him if he knew me. He said I had _ forgotten him, but I had _ his life. My friend was quite _ and asked him how I had done this. He said twelve years ago I was teaching a stress management class and he was one of the _ .I asked the group what their number one _ was and most of them said it was from their bosses. I listened to everyone, then 49 _ a chair and invited everyone to stand on it. I wanted them to look at the room from _ there. After that, I asked the group to think about how the room looked _ when they changed their perspective . Then I asked them to _ their bosses. Was this the same person who had _ their good qualities and hired them? Do they remember how _ they were to be chosen for the job? He said I looked at him and asked if he had ever thanked his boss for the _ to earn a living and _ him new skills and to be a better employee. He said he went back to work the next day with a thank-you card to his _ . He learned to deal with stress in a smart way. Now he has been the manager of the restaurant for eight years. He said I had taught him to look at life from different perspectives and to express _ .
